headline: Could Super Micro Computer Stock Be the Comeback Story of 2025?
summary: Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI) has been one of the most polarizing stocks to own this year.  It started out as a hot artificial intelligence (AI) company with mammoth potential, but it has recently become a risky investment with questionable and potentially inflated numbers due to poor accounting controls and procedures.  The stock has been rallying again, but it's still down more than 60% from its 52-week high of $122.90.

headline: Super Micro Stock Slips. Why SMCI Had Such a Tough Week.
summary: Super Micro Computer stock has had a rough week, with shares down double digits over four straight days.  The artificial intelligence server maker looks to be breaking its previous yo-yo pattern where the stock has fallen, just to rise again the next day.  Shares, trading under the ticker  SMCI  were down 0.2% to $37.84 in early premarket trading Friday.

headline: Better Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock: Super Micro Computer vs. Dell
summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) investing covers a broad range of companies, including hardware, software, end users, and many that cover a large part of this spectrum.  On the hardware side, Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) has reigned supreme as the top stock.  Companies like Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI) and Dell (NYSE: DELL) make hardware for servers that run these intense AI calculations and are critical in the AI value chain.

headline: Better Recovery Story Buy for 2025: Super Micro Computer vs. Intel
summary: This year has been an incredible one for many companies, especially technology players operating in the area of artificial intelligence (AI).  Analysts expect today's $200 billion AI market to top $1 trillion by the end of the decade, so companies and investors getting in on this area now could win big.  Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI) and Intel (NASDAQ: INTC) both have faced challenges in the past months, and this has weighed on their stock performance.
